name: Coast High Country Inn

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel in July 2006. Given one of the kitchenette units, which was handy. Hotel could use a bit of upgrading but overall it was clean and comfortable. Location is right in downtown Whitehorse, and the hotel provides a shuttle to the airport. The restaurant is quite good, and the lobby is comfortable to hang out in. Staff were friendly. The hallways and our room smelled a bit like smoke, even though these were non-smoking areas. There is no air conditioning so when it's hot, it's hot. Would recommend this hotel but not for a long stay.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel; Good location.

reviews.text: We stayed here in September 2005 because it is the approved hotel for the business I work for. Some of the rooms are nice; spacious and updated. Others, like the "standard room" we were in the first night are not so nice. The standard room was extremely small (think hostel), the bathroom did not have tub and the only window was tiny as well - and everything seemed to be original fixtures. The whole hotel including rooms appear to be clean. We did have a large cigarette hole burn in the quilt both nights, the staff at the front desk didn't seem concerned, even though these are supposed to be non-smoking rooms. We upgraded ourselves to a room with a two person jacuzzi tub and king size bed our last night - it was an extra $40 but worth it - a lot more room, and much nicer to be in - the tub itself was worth it.
reviews.title: It's OK - not bad, not terribly good; it'll do....

reviews.text: This hotel was okay, nothing special. Room was clean enough, but a little cramped. There was some mold in the bathtub, it looked worse than it probably was. The reception staff was neither friendly nor unfriendly -- they were just so-so.
reviews.title: Nothing special .....

reviews.text: The restaurant on the premise, where I had breakfast was passable. The waitress was unfriendly and I had to ask another waitress just for another cup of coffee. The food was alright, not really tasty.
reviews.title: High Country - good choice
had to have a hot tub
reviews.text: On the upside of things, there is a free internet cafe and free bus shuttle service to and from Whitehorse airport. Hotel is nicely located on the west part of the town. That was convenient.

description: Make the High Country Inn the centre of your Yukon adventure. Recent renovations including over $1 million spent on updated guest rooms, kitchen, parking and fitness facilities make the High Country the first choice for visitors to the Yukon. Complimentary wireless internet, two restaurants, and a quiet yet convenient location ensure that you have all the comforts of home.
